intro: Selenia jonesii, commonly known as Jones' selenia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Selenia jonesii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
